translated: Verses of the Elders
The Group of Sixes
The First Chapter
Migajāḷa
Well taught by the Visionary,

analyzed: buddhena adicca bandhunā  sabba sayojana atītaḥ  sabba vaṭṭa vināsanaḥ
translated: the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun,🔽Beyond all the fetters,🔽destroyer of all the round of rebirths,
The way out, the way across,
the uprooter of the root of craving,🔽Having cut down the root of the poison tree,
he leads to the state of peace.
For the cutting down of the root of ignorance,

analyzed: kammayanta vighāṭanaḥ  viññāṇānam pariggahe  ñā aṇ avajira nipātano
translated: the destroyer of the machine of kamma,🔽The falling of the diamond-truth🔽on the grasping of consciousness,
The revealing of feelings,
the liberator from attachment,
The contemplation with knowledge🔽of existence as a pit of glowing embers,
The great taste, the good depth,
the warding off of old age and death,
The noble eightfold path,
the stilling of suffering, the auspicious.
Having known kamma as kamma,
and ripening as ripening,🔽The seeing of present things
as they really are,
The great safe path, the peaceful,
the auspicious conclusion.”
… the elder Migajāḷa …🔽… the elder Migajāḷa …
